heading: ***WINTER WEATHER ADVISORIES THROUGH 1 PM IN NH***Today
text: Morning snow northeast tapering off. Clouds breaking for periods of sun, mostly west and south. Highs in the 20s north, 30s south, steady or falling during the afternoon. Northwest winds 10 to 15 mph, gusting to 25 mph, decreasing through the afternoon.

heading: Tonight
text: Briefly clearing south this evening, then mostly cloudy. Snow showers late evening in the St. Lawrence and Adirondacks, spreading southeast after midnight through the Green Mountains and NH. Lows in the teens north to the low 20s south. Winds light and variable.

heading: Christmas Eve
text: Briefly clearing south this evening, then mostly cloudy. Snow showers late evening in the St. Lawrence and Adirondacks, spreading southeast after midnight through the Green Mountains and NH. Lows in the teens north to the low 20s south. Winds light and variable.

heading: Thursday
text: Morning clouds and snow showers, a dusting to 3 inches, highest northeast, becoming scattered in the northern mountains, and limited breaks of sun south. Blustery and colder. Highs in the 20s to near 30 north, in the 30s south, falling through the day. Light winds, becoming northwest 10 to 20 mph, gusting 25 to 35 mph.
